definition: settled/accomplished/ready
to stop/to halt/to park (a car)
at or in the very same.../suitable/adequate/fitting/proper/to replace/to regard as/to think/to pawn/(coll.) to fail (a student)
(onom.) dong/ding dong (bell)
to be/to act as/manage/withstand/when/during/ought/should/match equally/equal/same/obstruct/just at (a time or place)/on the spot/right/just at

sentences.english: When she was dressed to look like, is a lady.
sentences.chinese: 当她装扮停当赶到时，看上去俨然是一位贵妇人。

sentences.english: The ground is already being prepared for two bogus dichotomies.
sentences.chinese: 为两种虚假二分法登台的舞台已经准备停当。

sentences.english: I've put my entire life into apple-pie order.
sentences.chinese: 我把自己的一生都安排停当了。

sentences.english: The loaded waggons were standing in the courtyard.
sentences.chinese: 收拾停当的大车停在院子里。
所有的事都铺排得停停当当。

sentences.english: She worked hard in order that everything would be ready by 6 o'clock.
sentences.chinese: 她拼命干活以便惠临点时把一切都筹备停当。

sentences.english: After all the preparation, we started the trip to the bride's home.
sentences.chinese: 一切准备停当，要去接新娘了。

sentences.english: We must get the house ready for our guests.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须把房子收拾停当，以期我们的客人随时入住。

sentences.english: Things like kitchen knives and well prepared pot roasts .
sentences.chinese: 比如研究厨房刀具和准备停当的罐子烤鸡。

definition: everything in its place and ready (idiom)
clothes and other items packed for traveling/baggage/luggage
all/every
appropriate/proper/ready
to make oneself presentable/to freshen up
to clear up/to tidy up/to pick up/to repair
to rinse the mouth and wash the face
to wash the face and rinse the mouth
to prepare/to arrange (sth to be offered)
to be seated
to find a place for/to help settle down/to arrange for/undisturbed/peaceful
to put in order/to tidy up/to pack/to repair/(coll.) to sort sb out/to fix sb
to go on a journey/to leave
to set out/to leave
to hold a lamp/to light a lamp
to strike camp
